resources.string: Cochez pour activer le thème sombre

Sauvegardera les messages dans la boite de réception et empêchera leur diffusions à d\'autre applications de messagerie, arrêtant ainsi les notifications. Peut bloquer les notifications de Light Flow.

Merci à jfeinstein10 sur GitHub pour la bibliothèque SlidingMenu, attenzione sur GitHub pour le bibliothèque ColorPickerPreference, et à touts les traducteurs.

Cocher l\'option \"Remplacer Messagerie Stock\" si vous voulez que cela marche correctement. Si vous rencontrez un Force Close aprés l\'activation, désinstaller puis réinstaller l\'application.

Couleur des Séparateurs Entre les Messages
Impossible de supprimer le thème par défaut
1) Choisir un thème prédéfini (ous pouvez éditer ce thème en allant dans " Menu -> Editer Thème)
2) Faire Menu -> Ajouter Thème et créer un nouveau thème
-L\'option supprimer effecaera la visualisation courrante (tant que ce n\'est pas le thème par défaut)
-Pour plus de thèmes, aller à Menu -> Plus de Thèmes
-Pour appliquer une police personnalisée (s\'appliquant à tous les thèmes) aller à Menu -> Police Personnalisée
Note: si vous selectionné un autre thème que les trois premier (Clair, Sombre, ou Noir), ces thèmes écraseront tout autre paramètre d\'apparence défini.
Les utilisateurs de la version Pro peuvent appliquer tous les thèmes téléchargés, mais pour éditer et ajouter des thèmes, vous devez télécharger le Theme Engine
Choisir la police à utiliser dans toute l\'application
Recherche Polices sur la Carte SD ...

Sliding Messaging supporte maintenant des thème customisables!

Caractéristiques:
 - 16 éléments thémables différents
 - Choisissez la couleur que vous voulez ou l'une de celel prédéfinies par Holo
 - Modifier de nombreux éléments non thémables auparavant
 - Paratger et télécharger de nouveau thèmes en ligne
 - Choisissez une police personnalisée sur votre stockage externe

Pour plus d'information sur le nouvel éditeur de thème, aller à Paramètre -> Paramètres d'Apparence Personalisée -> Menu -> Aide

Note : Si vous avez des lenteurs au lancement, essayer de cocher \"Mettre en Service de Fond\" dans les paramètres.\n\nComme toujours, rappelez vous que Sliding Messaging est toujours en beta et en constante amélioration et modifictation - évoluant au fil d\'Android.
Fait clignoter l\'icone dans la barre de notification. Marche uniquement pour l\'icone blanche

Sliding Messaging a remarqué que Go SMS est installée. Sachez que par défaut Go SMS bloque les notifications des autres messageries, cela signifie que vous ne recevrez aucune notification de cette application. Vous pouvez désactiver cela en allant à Go SMS Settings -> Advanced Settings -> Receive Settings et décocher l\'option \"Disable other message notification\".
Il est également recommandé de désactiver les images de contact ou des bugs d\'interface sont possibles, à moins que vous n\'utilisiez une version Android 4.2+
Convertira automatiquement les messages ayant plusieurs destinataires en MMS groupé. Fonctionne au mieux avec Android 4.2+
Envoyer les Longs Messages en MMS
Tansformera les messages plus long que le nombre désiré de SMS en un seul MMS
Nombre de SMS requis pour transformer le message en un seul MMS
The state of threads and recipients is inconsistent.

Soit il y a une erreur dans vos paramètres APN, soit vous ne les avez pas encore configuré, soit ils ne sont pas compatibles,ou alors peut-être êtes vous connecté a un réseau WiFi. \n\nA cause de limitations implémentées par Google (Depuis Android ICS 4.0),
Google restreint désormais l\'accés de Sliding Messagin aux APN définies pour le système et ce pour des \"raisons de sécurité.\" A cause de cela, vous devrais entrer ces valeurs manuellement si vous
souhaitez pouvoir envoyer des MMS avec Sliding Messaging. Vous pouvez trouver les paramètre APN pour votre opérateur en allant dans Paramètes Système-> Réseau et Sans Fil ->
Plus... -> Réseaux Mobiles -> Noms des Point d\'Accés et en selectionnant alors l\'APN que vous souhaitez utiliser. Copier alors les valeurs de \"MMSC\", \"MMS Proxy\", et \"MMS Port\"

dans les paramètres MMS de Sliding Messaging\ auxquels vous pouvez accéder via les apramètres généraux ou en touchant le bouton ci-dessous. Vous pouvez également les trouver par une petit recherche Google des APN pour votre opérateur.\n\n
Tant que ces valeurs ne seront pas correctement renseignées, vous ne pourrez pas envoyer de MMS.
Cache le nom de l\'expéditeur dans le widget DashClock
Ecrase les paramètres de vibration au-dessus
Chaque nombre doit être séparé par une virgule et un espace. Example \"0, 400, 100, 400\". Le schémas alterne les phase de vibration et de silence pour chaque durée spécifiée (en millisecondes)
Sliding Messaging existe également en version Pro avec de nombreuses possibilités ! Cela inclus:\n

-Possibilité d'enoyer et de voir des MMS et des messages de groupe
-Possibilité de partager des choses comme des liens internat, etc
-6 thèmes supplémentaires

-Possibilité de définir une image en fond des menus et des conversations
-Option de couleur de texte personnalisée
-Option d'animation personnalisée
-Et de nombreuses autres!
Les utilisateurs de la version Pro recevoivent également de plus fréquentes mise à jour et profitent de nouvelles fonctionnalités plus rapidement.

Si vous avez des erreurs en tentant d\'envoyer un MMS, c\'est surrement que les APN que vous avez entrées sont incorrectes ou pas encore compatible ou que vous êtes en WiFi (ce qui peut interférer avec les autres connexions).
Envoyez moi un mail SVP à jklinker1@gmail.com avec vos APN valide et fonctionnelle ainsi que le nom de votre opérateur que je puisse les ajouter à l\'application
Nom d\'Utilisateur et Mot de Passe
Certain opérateur utiliset des nom d\'utilisateur et des mots de passe dans leurs APN, si c\'est le cas de votre opérateur, renseignez ces valeurs
Mot de Passe. Peut être nul
Avoir de l\'aide pour les APN
Peuvent marcher mais nécessites parfois quelques modifications
Afin de vous faciliter la vie, sélectionner votre opérateur dans la liste.

Glisser depuis le bord gauche de l\'ecran pour vousrendre à la liste des conversations
Glisser depuis le bord droit de l\'écran pour vous rendre à l\'écran de rédaction d\'un nouveau message
Distance du bord de l\'écran depuis laquelle vous devez commencer votre geste (en % de l\'écran)

Pour activer ces gestes, ammorcer un glissement rapide depuis le bord de l\'écran vers le milier. Pour naviguer d\'une page a l\'autre, commencer votre geste depuis le centre en direction d\'un bord de l\'écran.
Représente la distance à parcouir durant votre geste pour l\'activer
Représente la vitesse à laquelle effectuer votre geste pour l\'activer

Contournement: Désactivera temporairement le WiFi durant l\'envoi puis tentera de restaurer la connection une fois terminé.
Cache le numéro des contacts dans la conversation
Affiche un fond derrière le widget

Ajouter de nouveaux modèles dans Paramètres -> Gérer les Modèles
La touche Entrée enverra le message au lieu d\'aller à la ligne
A utiliser seulement sur les ROM Customs supportant le multi-fenêtre. Lancera toute l\'application en mode multi-fenêtre.
Chosiir la couleur de la LED de notification. Sachez que votre LED ne supporte pas forcément toutes les couleurs
Affiche les dates dans une police toute petite.
Cacher notifications mais sauvegarder tout de même les messages de ce contact
Cacher notifications et ne pas sauvegarder les messages de ce contact
Sauvegarde certaines données comme les notifications individuelles et la liste noire sur la méméoire de stockage externe
Divise les longs SMS en plusieur de taille compatible. Activer seulement si vous avez des problèmes pour envoyer de longs messages avec votre opérateur
Place l\'Action Bar en haut de l\'écran pour l\'interface Cards UI
Limiter le Nombre de Conversations Chargées au Démarrage
Charge 15 conversations au démarrage au lieu de toute pour gagner en temps

Compresse l\'image pour l\'envoyer plus facilement avec les données mobiles. Si c\'est désactivé, les images seront envoyées à leur résolution maximale. Merci de faire attention, certains opérateursne supporte pas l\'envoie d\'images avec des résolutions maximales. Vous pourrez avoir des erreurs.
Envoyer les MMS avec l\'application de messagerie stock, idéal si vous avez des problèmes pour configurer l\'envoie de MMS via Sliding Messaging.
Le test de notification sera effectué quand l\'écran sera en veille.
Seulement applicable quand les nouveaux popup sont utilisés
Cocher pour activer la sécurité au démarrage.

Utiliser Titre Sombre pour les Cartes
Suivez l\'application sur Twitter pour être au courant des mises à jours et des futures innovations !\nhttp://www.twitter.com/SlidingSMS
Ceci remplacera toutes les sauvegardes précédentes.
Does not allow Sliding Messaging to save MMS messages, allowing your stock app to do so instead, even if you have checked the \"Override Stock Messaging\" option.
Will automatically insert draft into message entry box if present. If disabled, you will get a popup box to choose whether or not to insert each draft
Jouera un son quand un message sera envoyé
Caches conversations in the background to allow for faster loading times, has potential to affect battery life. This feature is still experimental. UPDATE: Disabled for now, caused too many crashes
Sets the number of conversations to be cached and quickly loaded at application startup and in the background

PLEASE READ: Enabling this will greatly increase the speed of Sliding Messaging, it will also backup all your SMS messages to an external service for safekeeping and delete them from the SMS database. You will not be able to see these messages in Sliding Messaging or any other messaging app.
WARNING: May backup and delete unread messages if scheduled before they are seen.
Ne pas supprimer le jour précédent
Keep the last day in the manifest so that you have only those messages after the backup and delete

RECOMMENDED: this will delete all messages after backup is complete to increase speed and fluidity of Sliding Messaging.\nWARNING: it will also delete MMS which are not backed up through this utility.
Will display a small notification bar at the top of the screen when a new message has been received
Please select carrier from the drop-down menu or configure APN settings manually.
Loads only 10 conversations at app startup for speed purposes
Choose when the conversation list should stay on the screen instead of being hidden in the drawer
Adds a counter in front of split messages to keep them in correct order. Example: (1/3)
Replaces popup with a fully functioning version of the app that shows as a dialog box over other apps instead of taking the entire screen
More on this for another update... ;)
Creates a chathead bubble that will allow you to quickly open and close the app on top of any other app
Move SlideOver to the left or right side of the screen
Adjust where SlideOver appears on the vertical axis
Adjust how much of the SlideOver bubble is visible on the screen
Distance on screen that you have to pull to activate SlideOver
Adjust how big the conversation arc is on the screen
SlideOver is still heavily under development. Do not submit requests, or even suggestions, for it at this time.
Choose the action that occurs when you have activated the dashed part of the SlideOver arc
Closes the popup after you have replied to a message
Adjusts the size of the SlideOver popup on screen. Useful if when keyboard is showing your messages get cut off due to lack of space, or if you don\'t want it to take up too much of your screen
Only show the popup when you have unlocked the device and there is a new message, otherwise let the SlideOver bubble handle new messages
Override some custom app settings for the most optimized/quickest behavior.\nNOTE: Disables some settings, including contact pictures.

With the latest update, we have made a few great strides toward a completely lag free app. But obviously this is a difficult task because of the style and what we are trying to do with the app. It is very memory intensive and uses a lot of resources to load so many messages at once. Many more than any other messaging app has to do. That is why it can be a little more sluggish than most if you have a ton of messages.


As for my speed tip, you have 2 options really. Both are compromises, but that is what you are gonna have to deal with in an app like this:


1.) DELETE MESSAGES! This is what we have been preaching since the beginning. IT WILL HELP YOU :) this is my first suggestion.


I understand that some people may not want to do this though, because they like to keep them for their records. There are backup solutions out there for this purpose. Use them. Deleting messages makes a huge difference if you have a ton of them. For reference, the app works flawlessly, zero lag, on my nexus 4 with around 2000 messages that I have now. I can't test more than that right now obviously, but if you are someone that keeps 10000 on your phone or some ungodly amount like this, obviously this is going to have a severely negative effect with our app.


Like i said, this is my first suggestion to everyone.


2.) Check the "override for performance" option under advanced settings and set your theme to cards 2.0.


This is more of a workaround, but it is, from my experience, a set of default settings that are the most optimized and work the best on any phone. It does take away some of the customization. But your themes and stuff, for the most part, will work. I just took out some of the extra, unnecessary things. This option is a compromise. If you aren't willing to clear out your inbox, try it out. It will work better, I know this for a fact, but it will also take away some of your settings, know that.


I honestly don't want to hear about lag or stuttering that much any more. We have given you the tools to fix it. If you choose not to use them, then so be it. But they are there and that is how this is gonna work :)

This tip is definitely more of a workaround, but I am tired of people telling us that they can't get MMS to download. Sending is a whole 'nother issue, but downloading will work on every phone, every time, if you know how to set it up.


I have emailed this out so many times that I think it is just time to put it in here for everyone to see.


So here is how you should set up downloading MMS messages:


1.) check the receive through stock option.


This option makes it so that it doesn't matter what other settings you have, your message will use the stock apps services to download. It doesn't matter if you have override stock checked or not. This lets the stock app handle all downloads so you don't have to worry about APN's or a WiFi fix that so many people hate us for.


2.) In the stock messaging app, check the auto download option.


This is just what it sounds, it will automatically download your messages for you when the carrier receives them. It isn't slower than having to push the download button, and there really are no downsides to this.


3.) Un-check the auto-download button in Sliding Messaging


This will make sure that you aren't getting double notifications.


So there you go, this is really the best way to handle downloading MMS and it will work flawlessly every time, just like the stock one should. It will still throw the Sliding Messaging notification as well, so no problems there.


EVERYTHING WILL WORK HOW IT SHOULD, EVERY TIME


So now we will have no more problems with downloading MMS! :)

Settings Overview (be aware some of these are only accessible by checking the "Show All Settings" option in advanced settings):


1) Horizontal Positioning determines whether the bubble is on the right or left of the screen
 2) Vertical Positioning sets how far from the top of the screen the bubble is
 3) Sliver Widths changes the amount of bubble you see, lower the sliver width, the less you will see on the edge of the screen
 4) Activation Width is the percent of the screen that the arc covers to activate the popup
 5) Arc Break Point will adjust the length of the dashed line on the bottom half of the arc
 6) Secondary action lets you select what happens when you are in the dashed area, either opening to the conversation list or creating a new message
 7) Enable haptic feedback, that one is self explanatory. vibrate on or off
 8) Auto-close SlideOver will close it when you have replied to a new message, very convenient for exiting quickly and getting back to what you were doing
 9) SlideOver Side changes the padding on the top and bottom of the popup window, making it smaller or much larger. Be careful of setting values to small though, then it wont show at all



Now, as for the main features of SlideOver:


1) There is the new popup which everyone can take advantage of to see an entire conversation when a new message comes in, MMS support for that conversation, etc. Lots better than the old popups
 2) The bubble allows you a "chatheads", yet extremely minimal interface, which you can allows use to pull up the app from anywhere at any time, whether or not you have new messages or just want to compose a new one
 3) When you do have new messages, you can quickly see a preview of each message and depending on how far you slide your finger from the bubble, it will highlight a different conversation which will then allow you to quickly access that conversation. That way, you can allows quickly tell how many new messages you have and decide which you actually want to respond to first, or at all
 4) There are 3 buttons at the top of the window when SlideOver has been activated and the arc is shown on screen to easily allow you to clear all of the notifications, close slideover all together and get the bubble out of the way, or go to settings to move it around or whatever you want to do with it

I get a lot of questions as to "why I can't see my contact pictures" or "some of my contacts don't show up in the app?!"


There is good reason for this, it is because we only pull pictures and contacts from your google account. The reason behind this is 1) it is easier for us, and 2) it is quicker because we only have one place to look for pictures, decreasing loading times.

As for the solution, there are many apps out there that will accomplish this task for you quickly and easily. I recommend:


1.) Haxsync


2.) Contact Picture Sync


3.) Ubersync


All these programs work well and will get you the contact pictures that you want so dearly :)
Use only SlideOver to handle notifications, hiding them from the status bar. WARNING: This will disable LED functionality.

I've had multiple requests to take advantage of the new APIs introduced in Android 4.3 that allow for listening to when notifications are posted and dismissed and taking advantage of that for marking a message as read.


Any users who is on Android 4.3 can now do this by going into their system settings, security, and clicking the "Notification Access" option (or simply by clicking on this tip).


You will then be taken to a list of all apps which have added this ability and simply enable Sliding Messaging with the check box. From now on, whenever you swipe away the notification it will mark your message as read, eliminating the need for the "Read" button on the notification!

Thanks for purchasing Sliding Messaging Pro!\n\n
It may seem like there is a lot going on at first, but lets walk you though some initial setup, then you will be able to configure everything else on your own from the settings menu.
Check option if a white box appears around your SlideOver popup when using a custom background.
There are locked messages in this conversation, do you want to delete them?
It\'s our Facebook ChatHeads and Paranoid Android Halo implementation. The idea behind it is that the most used app on your phone, messaging, is always accessible.
If you can\'t find what you are looking for in any of the sections above, email us before giving a one star review. It never hurts to ask for help!

Hope you have enjoyed your trial!\n\nThe trial of Sliding Messaging Pro has now expired and if you wish to continue using the app, please upgrade to the full version. You will be able to continue using the free version as of now, but with extremely limited functionality.
None, send all messages as SMS
Do you have data or WiFi enabled and is your Google account set up for Google Voice? If not, you must set that up online first.
Also the message card for the Card+ UI.
Like our new emoji keyboard? Use it with any app with our new Sliding Emoji Keyboard project!
5 stars reviews keep us motivated to work hard and add new features!
Expands Floating Notifications by allowing to send Emojis
Vibrate and ring while in the middle of a call.
Close halo popup after sending the message
Does not affect regular halo usage
Attempts to get the correct APNs automatically from your device
Set Up Google Voice Message Receiving:

Syncs messages instantly when you receive them through Google Voice by listening for a notification. You must have the Google Voice app installed and notifications enabled from that app for this option to work correctly
Sets a refresh interval to intermediately go and check for new messages. Does not require the Google Voice app to be installed
If you have problems, please read the \"Developer Tip\" on receiving Voice messages

1) Android 4.3+ users can use the notification listener service, and users below that you need to use the accessibility service (both of which can be enabled by clicking the "Option 1" button).

 2) The accessibility service cannot cancel Google Voice notifications (this is a limitation of the Android system), but if you turn them off through the Voice app then Sliding Messaging won't receive the messages at all. If you are using OPTION ONE, you must have notifications enabled for Google Voice, meaning Jellybean (4.1 and 4.2) and ICS (4.0) users will get double notifications

 3) The "Refresh on Interval" option is still in the works and will not do anything this beta.
Enable Swipe to Mark as Read
Android 4.3 ONLY. Please read the developer tips on how to implement this function.
This low of an interval will use more battery and data!
Launch from the extension with SlideOver instead of the main app.
Select how you should be notified when your message has been delivered
Adds a button to the bottom of SlideOver that will take you to the full app. NOTE: For best results, set SlideOver height to 100%.
Only will work if you have an account selected for Google Voice.
Swipe in the middle to go between messages
All Conversations begin with a default of sending through SMS.
To switch to Google Voice, simply click the icon next to the message entry field!
Messages sent with Google Voice will be marked with the same icon, next to the date and time of the message.
That\'s it!\n\nThe status of the conversation is automatically remembered so you don\'t have to choose Google Voice or SMS every time!
